recipe_name: Caramelised apple pan bake with cream
author: Lesley Waters
method: Preheat the oven to 220C/425F/Gas 7.  For the caramelised apple, melt the butter in an ovenproof frying pan and add the chopped apple. Stir well, then sprinkle over the sugar and cook for 2-3 minutes, until lightly caramelised. Meanwhile, for the batter, place all the batter ingredients into a food processor and blend to form a smooth batter.  Spoon the batter over the caramelised apples in the pan. Transfer to the oven and bake for 12-15 minutes, until well risen and golden-brown. Dust generously with icing sugar. Serve hot with a jug of cream on the side.
ingredients: 55g/2oz butter,  2 apples, peeled, cored and chopped,  55g/2oz caster sugar,  120g/4oz butter,  120g/4oz caster sugar,  115g/4oz self-raising flour,  1 free-range egg,  1 tbsp milk,  squeeze of lemon juice,  icing sugar,  single or double cream
